slider.label: View Angle:
slider.tool_tip: This option sets the camera view angle in radians, lower values look zoomed in, higher values look zoomed out. This option indirectly affects the Depth of Field strength because some calculations in Depth of Field depend on the camera view angle.
slider.name: camera_fov

slider.label: Camera Lag:
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the amount the camera should dynamically lag behind avatar movement. Higher values will result in a camera that lags behind the actual avatar movement which may or may not change the camera height in certain situations such as falling or jumping.
slider.name: camera_lag

slider.label: Distance:
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the multiplier with which camera offsets should be multiplied with. Depending on the chosen camera preset this might further offset the camera to the sides, not just zoom further out.
slider.name: camera_offset_scale

slider.label: Smoothing:
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the strength at which the camera should be smoothened out while moving. Lower values mean harsher movement while higher values mean smoother and more cinematic movement.
slider.name: camera_position_smoothing

slider.label: Zoom Time (s):
slider.tool_tip: This option sets the amount of time in s (seconds) it takes for the camera to interpolate between two focus points (when zooming onto something for instance).
slider.name: zoomtime

check_box.label: Turn Camera for Build/Edit Mode
check_box.name: edit_camera_movement
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the camera should be automatically repositioned to focus on the object when entering build and edit mode or not.

check_box.label: Turn Camera for Appearance Mode
check_box.name: appearance_camera_movement
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the camera should be automatically repositioned to focus on the avatar when entering appearance edit mode or not.

check_box.label: Disable Camera Constrains
check_box.name: DisableCameraConstraints
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the camera should be disallowed to leave the draw distance, go below the terrain or zoom into objects and avatars.

check_box.label: Use Cinematic Headtracking
check_box.name: UseCinematicCamera
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the camera should follow avatar head movement in third person or not.

button.label: Flycam Setup
button.name: joystick_setup_button
button.tool_tip: This button opens the configuration window for 3d mouse and controller setup to be used for free-form camera as well as avatar movement and build interactions.

slider.label: Vertical
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the rotation in degrees the head is allowed to move vertically to follow mouse movement on screen. This option will not prevent the head movement being synchronized with others.
slider.name: pitchfrommouse

slider.label: Horizontal
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the rotation in degrees the head is allowed to move horizontally to follow mouse movement on screen. This option will not prevent the head movement being synchronized with others.
slider.name: yawfrommouse

slider.label: Rotationstep ° [standing]
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the rotation in ° (degrees) your camera is allowed to make compared to the current avatar rotation before the avatar turns around to face the camera again. This option only works while standing still.
slider.name: camrotateslow

slider.label: Rotationstep ° [moving]
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the rotation in ° (degrees) your camera is allowed to make compared to the current avatar rotation before the avatar turns around to face the camera again. This option only works while moving.
slider.name: camrotatefast

check_box.label: Mouselook (First Person)
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether you can switch to the first person view of your avatar (aka Mouselook) or not when zooming in or hitting <green>M</green>.
check_box.name: AllowMouselook

check_box.label: Show my avatar in Mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles the visibility of your own avatar when in first person view (Mouselook).
check_box.name: first_person_avatar_visible

check_box.label: Show crosshairs in Mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles the visibility of onscreen crosshairs when in first person view (Mouselook).
check_box.name: ShowCrosshairs

check_box.label: Hide user interface in Mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the main user interface should be hidden while in first person view (Mouselook). Disabling this option allows limited interaction with the interface by holding down <green>Alt</green>.
check_box.name: MLInterfaceHide

check_box.label: Allow touching objects in Mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether you can touch objects and interact with them by aiming at them and hitting <green>LeftMouseButton</green>.
check_box.name: MLGrab

check_box.label: Enable 'realistic' camera behavior in Mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether the camera should be influenced by head movement while in first person view (Mouselook). With this disabled the camera will appear to hover above the ground at a semi-fixed height not being affected by the animations of your avatar.
check_box.name: UseRealisticMouselook

check_box.label: Smooth Mouselook movement
check_box.tool_tip: This option toggles whether camera movement while in first person view (Mouselook) should be slightly smoothened.
check_box.name: MouseSmooth

check_box.label: Invert Y Axis in Mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: This option controls whether the Y axis (up and down) should be inverted while in first person view (Mouselook). This option stacks with the joystick invert Y axis.
check_box.name: invert_mouse

slider.label: Mouselook sensitivity
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the sensitivity of mouse to camera movement. Higher sensitivity translates to more camera movement with the same mouse movement.
slider.name: mouse_sensitivity

slider.label: Rotationstep ° [mouselook]
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the rotation in ° (degrees) your camera is allowed to make compared to the current avatar rotation before the avatar turns around to face the camera again. This option only works while in first person view (Mouselook).
slider.name: camrotateml

slider.label: X Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the X axis relative to the camera focus point, where X works as zoom modifier for both Y and Z axis on a courve.
slider.name: CameraOffsetFrontView_X

slider.label: Y Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Y axis relative to the camera focus point, where Y is the horizontal offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetFrontView_Y

slider.label: Z Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Z axis relative to the camera focus point, where Z is the vertical offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetFrontView_Z

slider.label: X Focus
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the focus point on the X axis, where X is the depth. X (depth) is affected by Y (left and right) and Z (up and down), they will change the path depth takes either to the front or backside of your avatar.
slider.name: FocusOffsetFrontView_X

slider.label: Y Focus
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the focus point on the Y axis, where Y is left and right. Y affects X, it will change the path depth takes on a horizontal line.
slider.name: FocusOffsetFrontView_Y

slider.label: Z Focus
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the focus point on the Z axis, where Z is up and down. Z affects X, it will change the path depth takes on a vertical line.
slider.name: FocusOffsetFrontView_Z

slider.label: X Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the X axis relative to the camera focus point, where X works as zoom modifier for both Y and Z axis on a courve.
slider.name: CameraOffsetGroupView_X

slider.label: Y Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Y axis relative to the camera focus point, where Y is the horizontal offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetGroupView_Y

slider.label: Z Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Z axis relative to the camera focus point, where Z is the vertical offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetGroupView_Z

slider.label: X Focus
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the focus point on the X axis, where X is the depth. X (depth) is affected by Y (left and right) and Z (up and down), they will change the path depth takes either to the front or backside of your avatar.
slider.name: FocusOffsetGroupView_X

slider.label: Y Focus
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the focus point on the Y axis, where Y is left and right. Y affects X, it will change the path depth takes on a horizontal line.
slider.name: FocusOffsetGroupView_Y

slider.label: Z Focus
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the focus point on the Z axis, where Z is up and down. Z affects X, it will change the path depth takes on a vertical line.
slider.name: FocusOffsetGroupView_Z

slider.label: X Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the X axis relative to the camera focus point, where X works as zoom modifier for both Y and Z axis on a courve.
slider.name: CameraOffsetRearView_X

slider.label: Y Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Y axis relative to the camera focus point, where Y is the horizontal offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetRearView_Y

slider.label: Z Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Z axis relative to the camera focus point, where Z is the vertical offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetRearView_Z

slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the X axis relative to the camera focus point, where X works as zoom modifier for both Y and Z axis on a courve.
slider.name: CameraOffsetRightShoulderView_X

slider.label: Y Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Y axis relative to the camera focus point, where Y is the horizontal offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetRightShoulderView_Y

slider.label: Z Offset
slider.tool_tip: This option controls the position offset of the camera on the Z axis relative to the camera focus point, where Z is the vertical offset applied to the X axis.
slider.name: CameraOffsetRightShoulderView_Z

slider.name: CameraOffsetLeftShoulderView_X

slider.name: CameraOffsetLeftShoulderView_Y
